meanings.definition: Past tense of 'tech': to equip with technology.
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I teched my computer with the latest software updates.
meanings.sent2: She teched her phone by installing a new app for editing photos.
meanings.sent3: The robot teched itself up with all the gadgets it could find.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was teched with interactive whiteboards and tablets.
meanings.sent5: He teched his workshop with state-of-the-art tools and machinery.

meanings.definition: Adjective: having knowledge or skill in technology.
meanings.sent1: The teched engineer quickly fixed the broken computer.
meanings.sent2: She is the most teched person in our group when it comes to coding.
meanings.sent3: The teched student amazed everyone with her ability to program robots.
meanings.sent4: The teched team developed a new app that revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent5: He felt proud to be the most teched individual in his family.

meanings.sent1: The device operated teched, responding instantly to commands.
meanings.sent2: She navigated the virtual world teched, using all the available tools.
meanings.sent3: The robot moved teched through the obstacle course, impressing the audience.
meanings.sent4: The presentation was delivered teched, showcasing the latest advancements.
meanings.sent5: He typed teched on the keyboard, completing the task in record time.
